title: Hockey hits back at Downer spy conspiracy theory
text:
Washington DC | Australia's ambassador Joe Hockey has hit back at one of Donald Trump's closest allies, Lindsay Graham, after the Senator issued a thinly-veiled accusation that Alexander Downer spied against the president's 2016 campaign.

Republican Senator Graham, who has morphed over the years from fierce Trump critic to devoted supporter, wrote to Mr Hockey late on Wednesday (Thursday AEST) demanding that Australia assist Attorney-General William Barr's investigation into the so-called Papadopolous affair.

"We reject your characterisation" of Alexander Downer, Ambassador Joe Hockey tells Lindsay Graham. Fairfax Media

Senator Graham, who heads the powerful Senate judiciary committee, said in his letter - which was also directed at the UK and Italian ambassadors in Washington - that Mr Downer as London High Commissioner in 2016 was "directed" to contact a junior Trump campaign staffer to "relay information" on the campaign to the FBI.

In firmly worded letter issued early on Thursday morning in Washington, Mr Hockey told Senator Graham that since late May the Australian government has been clear about its willingness to cooperate with Mr Barr's inquiry.

"In your letter you made mention of the role of an Australian diplomat," he wrote. "We reject your characterisation of his role."
description: "We reject your characterisation" of Alexander Downer's role in the Russia inquiry, says Ambassador Joe Hockey to trump loyalist Senator Lindsay Graham.
